intro: Thismia panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian Thismia, is a rare and enigmatic flowering plant native to the humid lowland forests of Panama. It belongs to the family Thismiaceae, a group of plants known for their unique adaptations to nutrient-poor environments. The plant exhibits a myco-heterotrophic lifestyle, meaning it lacks chlorophyll and relies on fungal networks for its nutrients. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, typically white or pale green, and are adapted for specific pollinators. Due to habitat loss and limited study, this species remains poorly understood and is considered endangered.
